issue.title: Qt/C++ Gui Developers Wanted for RetroShare
issue.body:
hi,
our Retroshare gui isnt more up to date, my changes makes no real big improvements.
libretroshare is under active Development but the Qt Gui since lots of years no active improvements & developed.

But there comes from time to time few pull requests or small improvements but thats not enough.

- @G10h4ck working only on the libretroshare part & json api.
- @csoler has not much time i know.


We need some active Qt Gui Developers to improve the Gui and make it useable and stabil & add new improvements.

There are lots of todos.
Any new helpers are welcome to Retroshare project.

some todos:
**Ideas for v.0.6.7 [ Todo list - 2022 ]**
https://github.com/RetroShare/RetroShare/issues/2549

**Home V2 Display the latest Channel content:**
https://github.com/RetroShare/RetroShare/issues/1424

**[Qt] Add a Friend Requests Page** 
https://github.com/RetroShare/RetroShare/issues/1794

**[Qt] Friends Avatars needs to be cached/stored**
https://github.com/RetroShare/RetroShare/issues/1706

**[Qt] New Comments Viewer needed** 
https://github.com/RetroShare/RetroShare/issues/1722

**[Qt] People V2 Thumbnail View**
https://github.com/RetroShare/RetroShare/issues/1726

comment.body: Just to chime in from downstream: Please make porting away from QScriptEngine a priority. Qt5Script is deprecated since 5.5, was only ever meant as a porting aid from Qt4, and should be ported away to QJSEngine. It is also a stepping stone to eventually port to Qt6, whenever that is possible.

issue.title: Debian 10 repo key signature expired
issue.body:
On Debian10/KDE, I get this at `sudo apt-get update`:
```
Err:9 http://download.opensuse.org/repositories/network:/retroshare/Debian_10  InRelease
  The following signatures were invalid: EXPKEYSIG 62EB1A0917280DDF network OBS Project <network@build.opensuse.org>
...
An error occurred during the signature verification. The repository is not updated and the previous index files will be used. GPG error: http://download.opensuse.org/repositories/network:/retroshare/Debian_10  InRelease: The following signatures were invalid: EXPKEYSIG 62EB1A0917280DDF network OBS Project <network@build.opensuse.org>
W: Failed to fetch http://download.opensuse.org/repositories/network:/retroshare/Debian_10/InRelease  The following signatures were invalid: EXPKEYSIG 62EB1A0917280DDF network OBS Project <network@build.opensuse.org>
W: Some index files failed to download. They have been ignored, or old ones used instead.
```

comment.body:
I left a [comment](https://build.opensuse.org/project/show/network:retroshare#comment-1838681) and emailed buildservice@lists.opensuse.org.
Furthermore, it is wrong to simply close the issue as "closed". The issue is not fixed. Just because you close issues, bugs and problems do not go away.

issue.title: Tor bridges
issue.body: At the moment of login there should be an option to select if the program should connect to Tor directly, or through bridges or Snowflake as the Tor Browser allows.

comment.body: for now bridges are not implemented. This is on our todo list.
